Detailed Description

Core of the simulation: interaction between the integrator and the cell collection.

This class controls the simulation loop over time. It has a cell collection and an interface to the integrator used for computing the dynamics. It outputs the trajectories and other data to the Output object.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Simulator::Simulator (  ) 

Default constructor initialize the cell collection with input object.

Initializes the cell collection, the integrator context, the output object and the time variable.

void Simulator::computeTrajectoryTimeSlice ( int  iSlice  ) 

Compute the evolution over a time slice of length timeMeshSliceLength_.

Output the state to the output object.

Parameters:
iSlice [in] Index of the time slice (defined in timeMesh_), 0 <= iSlice <= nTimeSlices-1.

  • Integration loop over the time slice.

  • Initialize the timeSliceCellsAvg_ object.

The division events define subslices (t0,t1) dividing the time slice. We initialize t0 = timeMesh_(iSlice) and t1 = 0.

  • Loop over the subslices.

  • t1 = min( timeEnd, timeNextDivision )

  • Initialize the timeSlice_ object.

  • Integrate the spatial dynamics.

  • Loop over time in the subslice.

  • Insert the time slice data to the trajectory list.

  • Compute the average over the cells of the time slice.

  • Accumulate the average number of cells.

  • Accumulate the state of the milieu.

  • Accumulate the average over the time slice for each cell in the timeSliceCellsAvg_ object and increment the samples count by nCells.

  • t0 = t1.

  • Insert the time slice data to the cells average array. Uses the + operator of class TimeSliceCellsAvg.

  • Insert the time slice data to the cells-trajectories average array. Uses the + operator of class TimeSliceCellsAvg.

Compute all the propensities in order to reduce the errors generated by the optimization method.

void Simulator::computeTrajectory ( int  iTraj  ) 

Compute one trajectory and its average over the time mesh.

  • Clear timeMeshTrajectory_.

  • Initialize timeMeshCellsAvg_.

  • Loop over time: computeTrajectoryTimeSlice(iSlice).

  • Output the averaged trajectory.

void Simulator::computeNTrajectories (  ) 

Compute N trajectories with same initial conditions and compute the averages.

  • Initialize the timeMeshCellsTrajectoriesAvg_.

  • Initialize the cell collection.

  • Compute trajectory.

  • Output the cells-averaged trajectory.

  • Output the phases of the cells (to check the distribution of cell cycles.

void Simulator::computeParameterSet (  ) 

Compute N trajectories for each combination of a set of parameters.

The results are written in a different directory for each parameter combination.

Parameters values are stored in a public static array of class Input. The computePropensities function has direct access to these values.

bool Simulator::computeSimulationStep (  ) 

Compute a step of simulation, in general one time slice, in order to return the control to the GUI.

Member Data Documentation

CellCollection Simulator::cellCollection_

IntegratorContext<IntegratorGillespieModified> Simulator::integratorContext_ [private]

The integrator context used for the simulation.

The IntegratorContext class is a template class with template type defining the type of integrator (Gillespie, modified Gillespie, etc).

int Simulator::iTimeSlice_ [private]

Iterator over time slices.

double Simulator::simulationTime_ [private]

Total time of simulation.

All the trajectories will be compute for time 0 < t < simulationTime_ (with some inprecision due to the time mesh definition).

int Simulator::nTrajectory_ [private]

Number of trajectories to compute.

int Simulator::iTrajectory_ [private]
